meanings.definition: To sulk more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah outsulked her brother when he lost.
meanings.sent2: She always outsulks her friends when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he outsulked everyone when he didn't get the dessert he wanted.
meanings.sent4: Her dark cloud of sulking outsulked the sunshine of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's pout outsulked all the other kids at the playground.

meanings.definition: To be in a sulking mood more than others.
meanings.sent1: Tom outsulked his classmates after not getting the lead role in the play.
meanings.sent2: She outsulks her siblings whenever she has to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat outsulked the dog when it didn't get the attention it wanted.
meanings.sent4: His gloomy expression outsulked the rainy weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The grumpy old man outsulked all the other customers at the cafe.

meanings.definition: To show a sulky attitude more than others.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, he outsulked his colleagues when his idea was rejected.
meanings.sent2: She always outsulks her friends when she doesn't get her favorite seat.
meanings.sent3: The child outsulked the other kids when he didn't win the game.
meanings.sent4: Her frown outsulked the smiles of the other party guests.
meanings.sent5: The teenager's pouting outsulked the rest of the family during dinner.
